intro: Boechera serpenticola, commonly known as the serpent's tail rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial species is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and its clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant is adapted to withstand drought and poor soil conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
